shed: Sheds are accessory structures and must meet accessory setbacks; front yard placement is not allowed.
Typical residential side/rear setbacks ≥ 5 ft; confirm parcel specifics in Zoning Map.
Height and total accessory area limits apply per Chapter 19 (Accessory Uses).
kitchen: Structural changes or enlarged window openings require building review.
Electrical additions require compliance with current code; include in valuation unless trade fees are published separately.
New water lines/fixtures require plumbing review; include in valuation unless trade fees are published separately.
basement: Egress is required for any new sleeping room; smoke/CO detectors must meet current code.
If HVAC ducts/vents are added or modified, an HVAC/Mechanical permit is required.
windows: New or enlarged openings require building review; energy code and egress may apply for bedrooms.
fence: Height limits and vision triangles apply; corner lots have special rules. Confirm setbacks in zoning.
deck: Decks are residential additions/alterations for valuation; plan exam applies. Guard/handrail requirements per code.
demo: Razing/interior demo is permitted; fee is minimum plus $/sqft.
Utility disconnects and disposal requirements apply.
move: Moving a structure across public ways requires special permitting and fees; route coordination required.
